text: Henry Graham Greene (2 October 1904 â€“ 3 April 1991) was a British writer. Greene was born in Berkhamsted, Hertfordshire. His family was wealthy and had owned slave plantations in Montserrat and St. Kitts. He graduated with a second-class degree from Balliol College, Oxford. He was a journalist before he became a novelist. Greene wrote novels, autobiographies, travel books, plays, screenplays, short stories and children's books. His Catholicism influenced his work. Greene had bipolar disorder.eNotes He died of leukaemia in Vevey, Switzerland. == References == == Other websites == * Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:English children's writers Category:English autobiographers Category:English journalists Category:English novelists Category:English playwrights Category:English Roman Catholics Category:English screenwriters Category:People with bipolar disorder Category:Writers from Hertfordshire Category:1904 births Category:1991 deaths
